feats.benefits: Use Acrobatics to Perform.
Become trained in another Lore subcategory.
Gain access to ancestry feats from another ancestry.
Craft alchemical items.
Cast detect magic at will as an arcane innate spell.

feats.prerequisites: trained in Athletics or Warfare Lore
feats.benefits: Don armor more quickly.
Become trained in a type of armor.

feats.prerequisites: trained in at least one skill
feats.benefits: Receive a fixed result on a skill check.
Earn Income by searching for deals.
Heal yourself or an ally in battle.
Distract a foe with a witty quip.
Hold your breath longer and gain benefits against inhaled threats.
Become an expert in a saving throw or Perception.
Treat falls as shorter than they are.
You’ve learned to mimic the abilities of spellcasters by studying their flourishes and words
Improve a target's attitude with your lies.
Fight more effectively as you Climb.
Conceal an Object using Stealth instead of Thievery.
Use Society to get along in noble society.
Use Crafting to identify magic items.
Pass yourself off as a member of a religion.
Die at dying 5, rather than dying 4.

feats.name: Different Worlds
feats.prerequisites: ability to select ancestry feats from multiple ancestries
feats.benefits: Create a second identity for yourself with a different name, history, and background.
feats.text: Your separate experiences in different societies have evolved into entirely separate lives. Create a second identity for yourself with a different name, history, and background. This identity must correspond to one of the ancestries whose ancestry feats you can select. You gain the trained proficiency rank in the Lore skill from the second background you chose (but you don’t gain any of the background’s other benefits), and you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to  Deception  checks when making a statement that would be true of your second identity or when disguising yourself as your second identity.  At the GM’s discretion, this feat can be used against non-humanoids if they have regular contact with humanoids or you are able to disguise yourself as a member of the target’s ancestry or type of creature.

feats.prerequisites: trained in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action
feats.benefits: Learn true and erroneous knowledge on failed check.
Prevent critical failures when Earning Income.
Conceal items from observers more effectively.
Track at your full Speed at a –5 penalty.
Increase your mount’s travel speed.
+2 to Decipher Writing about math and count items quickly.
Perform to fascinate observers.
Regain more HP from rest, recover faster from disease and poisons.
Step into difficult terrain.
Increase your Speed by 5 feet.
Forage for supplies to provide for multiple creatures.
Rapidly examine a body and Recall Knowledge about it.
Decipher Writing even when you can’t see the document well.
Coerce multiple targets simultaneously.
Make an Impression on multiple targets at once.
Increase your Bulk limits by 2.
Gather Information rapidly.
Make an Impression with Performance.
Craft basic tools without a basic crafter’s book.
+2 to initiative rolls.
Grant patients +2 to saves against getting a disease again.
Demoralize a creature without speaking.
Remain hidden after you Create a Diversion.
Use Deception to detect lies.

feats.name: Medical Researcher
feats.benefits: Kassi has taught you not only how to apply medicines with your medical skills but how to craft them as well.
feats.text: Kassi has taught you not only how to apply medicines with your medical skills but how to craft them as well. When you  Craft   healer's kits ,  vaccines ,  addiction suppressants ,  antidotes ,  antiplagues ,  elixirs of life , or other non-magical medical or healing items, you can use  Medicine  instead of  Crafting .

feats.benefits: Learn two new languages.
Use Nature to Treat Wounds.
Reduce creatures’ frightened condition values.
+2 to Occultism checks to Identify Magic with certain traits.
Steal or Palm an Object more effectively.
A religious token lets you act ﬁrst on a tie for initiative.
Coerce a creature quickly.

feats.prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism or Religion
feats.benefits: Identify Magic in 1 minute or less.
High Jump or Long Jump as a single action.
Repair items quickly.
Move swiftly as you Squeeze.

feats.name: Ravening's Desperation
feats.benefits: Your study of the Beast of Gluttondark has taught you how to make do in the most trying of circumstances rather than succumb to weakness.
feats.text: Your study of the  Beast of Gluttondark  has taught you how to make do in the most trying of circumstances rather than succumb to weakness. As long as your current Hit Points are less than half your maximum Hit Points, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to  Survival  and  Stealth  checks. If your current Hit Points are less than a quarter your maximum Hit Points, the circumstance bonus is +2 instead.

feats.benefits: Read the lips of people you can see.

feats.prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
feats.benefits: Identify a spell as a reaction as it's being cast.
Automatically succeed at commanding your mount to move.
Deal damage to a patient to gain +2 to Treat Wounds.
Create a token that grants a bonus against a spell or haunt.
Gather Information about secret societies and mystery cults.

feats.prerequisites: trained in Alcohol Lore, Cooking Lore, or Crafting
feats.benefits: +1 to Craft food and drink, including potions.

feats.name: Secret Speech
feats.benefits: Learn the secret language of a society.
feats.text: Choose a secret society (such as the Lacunafex or the Bellflower Network). You’ve learned that society’s secret cant or jargon, enabling you to share hidden messages when signing or speaking with others who’ve also learned it. If an observer succeeds at a Perception check against your  Deception  DC when you do this, they realize you are passing a message but fail to discern its content, unless they subsequently succeed at a Society check against your Deception DC. On a critical success, they learn not only the message, but also who you’re passing the message to.  You can take this feat multiple times. You learn the secret speech of a different society each time.

feats.benefits: Ward off a blow with your shield.
Learn sign languages.
Become trained in a skill.
Craft snares.
Gain bonuses to Craft certain items.
Maintain your balance in adverse conditions.
Use Society to Gather Information and Recall Knowledge.
More accurately recognize the tenets of your faith or philosophy.
Your thefts are harder to notice.
Identify nearby creatures through signs and clues.
+1 to Survival checks in certain terrain.
Sneak in certain terrain without attempting a check.
Disarm, Grapple, Shove, or Trip larger creatures.
Increase your maximum HP and reduce the DCs of recovery checks.
Teach an animal a trick.

feats.prerequisites: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
feats.benefits: Activate a magic item you normally can't activate.
Fight more effectively underwater.
+1 with a certain type of performance.
Become trained in a weapon type.
Reduce the Stealth penalty of your armor.

feats.prerequisites: expert in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
feats.benefits: Avoid misidentifying magic.

feats.prerequisites: expert in a skill with the Recall Knowledge action, Assurance in that skill
feats.benefits: Recall Knowledge as a free action once per round.
You have a specific disguise that you keep at the ready, worn underneath your outer garment.
Make a battle plan and roll Warfare Lore for initiative.
An animal becomes permanently helpful to you.
Reduce the bonuses against your repeated lies.
Leverage your connections for favors and meetings.
Treat Wounds on a patient more often.
Leverage your underworld connections for favors from criminals.
Gather Information without revealing your motive.
Create a Diversion for an ally.

feats.name: Encouraging Words
feats.benefits: You give an ally a quick pep talk, helping them recover.
feats.text:
You give an ally within 30 feet a quick pep talk, helping them recover. Attempt a Diplomacy check. The DC is usually 15, though the GM might adjust it based on the circumstances. If you have expert proficiency in Diplomacy, you can instead attempt a DC 20 check to increase the Stamina Points recovered by 5; if you have master proficiency, you can attempt a DC 30 check to increase the Stamina Points by 15; if you have legendary proficiency, you can attempt a DC 40 check to increase the Stamina Points by 25. No matter the result, the ally is temporarily immune to Encouraging Words until they either  Take a Breather  or rest for the day.
  The ally recovers 2d8 Stamina Points.  The ally recovers 1d8 Stamina Points.  The ally takes 1d8 mental damage, but this can reduce only Stamina Points, never Hit Points.

feats.prerequisites: expert in Religion, follower of a specific religion
feats.benefits: +2 to Request something of or Coerce members of your own faith.
The Arclords of Nex have achieved a unique mastery of magic.
Make an Impression on a target you've just met.

feats.prerequisites: Battle Medicine, can’t have a patron deity
feats.benefits: With limited access to divine healing magic, Rahadoumi often become adept at using ordinary medicine for when dangerous situations arise.
Gain a bonus to physically Demoralize a target.

feats.name: Juggle
feats.benefits: You can Juggle items and still use your hands between tosses.
feats.text: You can Juggle items and still use your hands between tosses. You can use the Juggle action in several ways.  You can start to Juggle with a single stored item, an item you were carrying, or an unattended item within your reach. The item must be of light or negligible Bulk. You Juggle the item until the end of your next turn, unless you use this feat against next turn to continue Juggling (see below). While you are Juggling, you can use this action again to add another item to the Juggle, which must meet all the same requirements. You can Juggle a number of items equal to one more than the number of hands you are using to Juggle.  You can also use this action to continue Juggling as long as you aren’t fatigued. When you do, you continue to Juggle until the end of your next turn. If you do not continue Juggling by the end of your turn, you cease Juggling and you drop all the items. You become fatigued if you continue Juggling for more than 10 minutes (60 rounds) within the course of an hour.  As long as you’re Juggling fewer than your maximum number of items, you have a free hand. You can wield weapons you are Juggling (but not shields or other items) as long as they can be wielded in one hand. For example, while you Juggle a dagger in one hand and wield a shield in the other, you are wielding the dagger but still have a free hand to Cast a Spell with a material component. Juggling two or more weapons with one hand doesn’t allow you to use feats that require two weapons each held in a different hand.

feats.benefits: Coerce a target into helping you longer.
Make Climbing safer for allies who Follow the Expert.
Craft magic items.

feats.prerequisites: expert in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
feats.benefits: Learn spells quickly and at a reduced cost.

feats.prerequisites: Godless Healing, you follow the Laws of Mortality
feats.benefits: You grant greater healing when the gods don’t interfere
Crawl at a faster rate.
Jump farther and higher.

feats.prerequisites: expert in Society; Connections or Underworld Connections
feats.benefits: Spend only 1 day to use Connections or Underworld Connections.
Set up a disguise in only half the time.
Roll a single Stealth check when sneaking with allies.
Pull yourself onto ledges quickly.
Greater benefits from Treat Disease and Treat Poison.
Targets you’re following take a penalty to notice you.
You spread rumors, which may or may not be true, about a specific subject.
+1 to spell saves from a creature you’ve Demoralized.

feats.name: Tweak Appearances
feats.benefits: You can alter a creature's clothing to improve their social impact.
feats.text: You spend 1 minute making quick adjustments to someone’s clothing and appearance, causing their words to carry more weight with an audience of your choice. While speaking to that audience, the target gains a +1 item bonus to  Diplomacy  and  Performance  checks. If you have master proficiency in  Crafting , the bonus increases to +2; if you have legendary proficiency in Crafting, the bonus increases to +3. This bonus lasts until this ability is used on the target again, the situation they were prepared for ends, or they next change their outfit.

feats.benefits: Gather Information without drawing attention and gain a bonus to Recall Knowledge about that subject.
Recall Knowledge about your Lore more effectively.
Treat several patients at once.
+2 to AC or saves against devices or traps you trigger while disarming.
Use Survival for your Initiative when in a specific terrain.
Gain a 1st-level ancestry feat.
Hirelings gain +2 to skill checks.
Quickly patch a broken item.
Improve bonuses when you Follow the Expert.
Your group can Hustle for up to 20 minutes longer.
Procure a piece of adventuring gear.
Crawl up to half your Speed.

feats.name: Steel Your Resolve
feats.benefits: Regain Stamina Points equal to half your maximum.
feats.text: Regain Stamina Points equal to half your maximum.

feats.benefits: +2 to Perception when you spend twice as long Searching.
Become more adept at using untrained skills.
Use First Aid to reduce frightened and sickened condition values.
Improve your ability to Maneuver in Flight.
Demoralizes foes when you roll for initiative.

feats.prerequisites: master in Religion, you follow a deity
feats.benefits: Calling out to your deity, you recite scripture to harm a foe
Intuit details about someone’s profession and residence.
Your magic becomes more difficult to identify.

feats.prerequisites: master in Crafting, deity who grants heal divine font
feats.benefits: You channel positive energy into restoratives that ward against harm

feats.prerequisites: master in Crafting, deity who grants harm divine font
feats.benefits: You pour negative energy into toxins you create to further debilitate your targets

feats.prerequisites: master in Nature, Occultism, or Religion
feats.benefits: Learn about your environment from resident spirits.
Frighten foes with occult secrets.
Pass a secret message to allies in your conversation.
You have a small group of admirers who tend to follow you around while you’re in civilized settlements.

feats.prerequisites: master in Survival; deity who grants the cold, fire, nature, or travel domain
feats.benefits: You rapidly adapt to environments through a combination of skill, meditation, and divine grace

feats.prerequisites: master in Diplomacy, you follow a deity or philosophy
feats.benefits: You point out a detail that incontrovertibly supports your faith, causing a listener’s mind to whirl
Search areas in half the time.
Take precautions against special senses.
Specialty Crafting Craft items more efficiently.
Influence the behavior of certain animals in the area.
Use Crafting to create item formulas.
Stand up for free without triggering reactions.

feats.prerequisites: Diehard, you have died at least once
feats.benefits: Your past has left you numb to death’s call

feats.name: Paragon Battle Medicine
feats.benefits: Kassi Aziril taught you her techniques that originated the modern use of Battle Medicine.
feats.text: Kassi Aziril taught you her techniques that originated the modern use of  Battle Medicine . When you successfully use Battle Medicine, you can also reduce the target's  sickened ,  enfeebled , or  clumsy  condition by 1 (this has no effect if you are subject to an effect continually applying the clumsy condition, like  enlarge ). If you are legendary in  Medicine , you can choose to reduce the target's  frightened  or  stunned  condition by 1 instead, and if you have the  Godless Healing  feat, you can choose to reduce the target's  stupefied  or  drained  condition by 1 instead. If you have the  Mortal Healing  feat, you can reduce all available conditions by 1 for a target who hasn't benefited from positive or healing magic in the last 24 hours, and if you roll a critical success before applying the effects of the feat, you reduce all available conditions by 2 for that target instead.

feats.benefits: Use Survival to Subsist on different planes.
Procure consumable items with Prescient Planner.
Climb swiftly.

feats.prerequisites: master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion; Recognize Spell
feats.benefits: Master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, Identify spells as a free action.
Swim quickly.
Pick a Lock with 1 action.
Afﬁx a Talisman in less time.

feats.prerequisites: master in Religion, you follow a deity
feats.benefits: You call upon your deity to grant you their protective blessing

feats.prerequisites: master in Religion, good or evil deity
feats.benefits: You imbue water with your deity’s blessing
Make Requests of others with lesser consequences.
Evade attempts to uncover your true nature.
Gain secret checks to detect poison by taste.
Move your full Speed while you Sneak.
Cause foes you Demoralize to flee.
Jump off walls.
Stride across the surface of a body of water.
Spend downtime to gain free lodging for a night.
Your group can Hustle for much longer.
Invest up to 12 magic items.
Grant allies +2 to initiative rolls when Scouting.
Jump impossible distances.
Ignore most requirements for crafting items.
Find guidance in the writings of your faith.
Quickly Decipher Writing using Society.
Increase your party’s travel speed through wilderness terrain
Create pidgin languages to communicate with anyone.
Remove disease or the blinded, deafened, doomed, or drained condition.
Quickly parley with foes.
Gain renown for your Performance Virtuosic Performer.
Gain renown for your Lore.
Hide and Sneak without cover or being concealed.
Survive extreme conditions.
Steal what would normally be impossible to steal.

feats.name: Reveal Machinations
feats.benefits: You convince a creature that you played a minor but recurring role in its life.
feats.text: You reveal that you played a minor but recurring role in another humanoid’s life—or at least convince them that’s the case. Attempt a  Deception  check against the target’s Will DC. On a success, the revelation makes them  frightened  2, and on a critical success they are frightened 3. In addition, you gain information about the subject as though you had attempted to  Recall Knowledge  about them using an appropriate skill and received the same result on your roll. You can’t use this ability against the same humanoid again until 1 day has passed and you’ve also successfully disguised yourself as a different person.

feats.benefits: Scare a target so much, they might die.
Use Arcana for checks for all magical traditions.
Gain constant effects of true seeing.

feats.name: Artokus's Fire
feats.benefits: Artokus developed a mixture of volatile materials that burns hotter and longer than typical alchemist's fire.
feats.text: Artokus developed a mixture of volatile materials that burns hotter and longer than typical alchemist's fire. You include this additive mixture when crafting your alchemist's fire. The alchemist's fire deals 1d4  persistent fire damage  in addition to what the alchemist fire would normally cause (for instance, a moderate alchemist's fire deals 1d4+2 persistent fire damage). A creature taking persistent fire damage from the alchemist's fire requires two successful flat checks to end the persistent damage, or one check if the creature had an assisted recovery that reduces the flat check to DC 10. The enhanced alchemist's fire burns even underwater, and any attempts to end the persistent damage by using water have no effect.

feats.name: Shaped Contaminant
feats.benefits: Through a combination of careful manipulation and precise breath control, you can deploy inhaled toxins precisely.
feats.text: Through a combination of careful manipulation and precise breath control, you can deploy inhaled toxins precisely. When you activate an  inhaled  poison, you can cause it to fill a 20-foot line that’s 5 feet tall rather than a 10-foot cube. You gain a +3 status bonus to saving throws against inhaled poisons that you activate.

feats.name: Astonishing Explosion
feats.benefits: Your bomb incorporates an explosive spark of wonder that leaves witnesses dumbfounded.
feats.text: Your bomb incorporates an explosive spark of wonder that leaves witnesses dumbfounded. Any target hit by your Strike with the bomb is  fascinated  by you for 1 round. On a critical success, the target is also  stunned 1 .

feats.name: Efficient Alchemy (Paragon)
feats.benefits: Prepare more alchemical items from your infused reagents.
feats.text: Your daily preparations are particularly efficient and plentiful. When using your infused reagents to create alchemical items during your daily preparations, you make a batch of three of a given item instead of a batch of two, or a batch of four if your field normally lets you create three of that item.   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Wish Alchemy
feats.benefits: You have learned Artokus Kirran's most hidden secrets, granting you the ability to create alchemy infused with the power of wishes.
feats.text: You have learned Artokus Kirran's most hidden secrets, granting you the ability to create alchemy infused with the power of wishes. Once per day when you use advanced alchemy during your daily preparations, you can spend a batch of infused reagents to create a wish vial containing a single common  arcane  spell of your choice of 8th level or lower. The spell must have a casting time of no more than 3 actions, no Cost, and must be able to target you. Only you can Activate the wish vial, which takes the same number of Interact actions as the spell's casting time and grants you the effects of the spell.

feats.name: Annihilating Swing
feats.benefits: You have learned from the brute destructive power of xulgaths and their kind.
feats.text: You have learned from the brute destructive power of  xulgaths  and their kind. You make a melee Strike that ignores any resistances the target has. If you target a solid unattended object or surface with your Strike, you might automatically destroy it without an attack roll. If you target any object or surface with Hardness 20 or less that isn't a magic item or the effect of a spell, you destroy it. If the target object or surface is a magic item or the effect of a spell, you attempt to  counteract  it using your attack bonus with the Strike for the counteract check. On a successful counteract check, you destroy the object or surface unless it has Hardness greater than 20, is an artifact, or is similarly difficult to destroy. You destroy up to a 5-foot cube of an object or surface larger than Medium.

feats.name: Invulnerable Juggernaut
feats.benefits: Gain resistance to all damage.
feats.text: You are unstoppable, able to shrug off mortal wounds with ease. You gain resistance equal to 3 + your Constitution modifier to all damage, and your resistance from raging resistance increases to 8 + your Constitution modifier.  In addition, if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points, you can end your rage as a reaction to stay at 1 Hit Point. If you do, you become  wounded 2  (or increase your wounded condition by 2 if you are already wounded).   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Silver's Refrain
feats.benefits: Learn the silver's refrain composition cantrip.
feats.text: You learn the  silver’s refrain  composition cantrip, which aids you when fighting  devils .

feats.name: Ringmaster's Introduction
feats.benefits: You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action.
feats.text: You announce the triggering ally with a litany of their legendary achievements, spurring them to action. The target is  quickened  this turn and can spend the extra action to Stride, Strike,  Demoralize ,  Feint , or  Perform .

feats.name: Song of the Fallen
feats.benefits: Gain the song of the fallen focus spell.
feats.text: The moving power of your songs can stir the spirits of the dead to rise once more and fight alongside you. You learn the  song of the fallen  composition spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Aura of Unbreakable Virtue
feats.benefits: Overwhelm evil creatures with your aura.
feats.text: You are a paragon of all that is good, your overwhelming aura causing evildoers to cower. All evil creatures within 15 feet of you take a –1 status penalty to checks and DCs that target you or your allies. This penalty is –2 against creatures you have taken an oath against (such as dragons if you have the  Dragonslayer Oath  feat). You can choose to suppress or resume this aura as an action, which has the  concentrate  trait.   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Banishing Blow
feats.benefits: The erratic teleportation magic you experienced in the Kortos Mounts has taught you a few tricks.
feats.text: The erratic teleportation magic you experienced in the Kortos Mounts has taught you a few tricks. You attempt an  Athletics  check to  Shove  the fiend that triggered your champion's reaction; on a success, the target can't teleport or summon creatures for 1 minute. On a critical success, the target is also  stunned 1  and can't teleport or summon creatures for 1 hour, and if you are on your home plane and the target is a fiend of level 18 or lower from another plane, it is also banished to its home plane. Your multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this attack.

feats.name: False Faith
feats.benefits: Droskar knows you may need to disguise yourself in societies that oppose your faith.
feats.text: Droskar knows you may need to disguise yourself in societies that oppose your faith. After spending 1 hour in prayer to Droskar, you can cast spells using the religious symbol of a different deity as your divine focus, and you can address verbal prayers to that deity. Droskar intercepts your prayers and answers them without the named god knowing.  This ability applies to the religious symbol of only one god at a time—making a different religious symbol work in this fashion requires another hour of prayer and causes the old one to cease functioning. You can always use a religious symbol of Droskar without affecting this ability.

feats.name: Denier of Destruction
feats.benefits: You can manipulate the same energies that the aeon orbs use to sustain life.
feats.text: You can manipulate the same energies that the   use to sustain life. You cast   on the triggering target. Instead of its normal effects, the   spell reduces the triggering damage by an amount equal to the Hit Points a 1-action   spell of that level would have recovered. As usual, if this reduces the damage to 0, it might also remove additional effects of the triggering attack, such as  injury  poisons.

feats.name: Emblazon Divinity
feats.benefits: Emblazon more equipment at the same time.
feats.text: Your sacred etchings imbue objects with power. It takes you only 1 minute to emblazon a symbol using  Emblazon Armament , and you can have up to four symbols emblazoned at a time. Each item can still have only one symbol emblazoned upon it, and if you exceed the limit of four, the oldest symbol disappears. These symbols can benefit even those who don’t follow the deity, provided they aren’t directly opposed (as determined by the GM).  You can select a different benefit for each emblazoned symbol, chosen from any you have from Emblazon Armament or other feats such as  Emblazon Energy  or  Emblazon Antimagic .   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Pesh Skin
feats.benefits: Your plant form sprouts hundreds of spines, and your blood causes mild hallucinations in creatures exposed to it.
feats.text: Your plant form sprouts hundreds of spines, and your blood causes mild hallucinations in creatures exposed to it. Each time a creature touches you, hits you with an unarmed attack, or hits you with a melee weapon attack while adjacent to you, that creature takes 1d6 piercing damage. Increase the damage to 2d6 if the polymorph spell is 8th level or higher, or to 3d6 if it’s 10th level.  When an adjacent creature damages you with piercing or slashing damage, it must succeed at a Fortitude save against your class DC or become  stupefied 1  (or stupefied 2 on a critical failure) until the end of its next turn.  These benefits last until you’re no longer polymorphed into a plant.

feats.name: Apex Companion
feats.benefits: Gain the apex companion focus spell.
feats.text: You can call upon the essence of every individual animal of a particular species to temporarily transform your animal into an exemplar of its kind. You learn the  apex companion  order spell. Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Verdant Presence
feats.benefits: The life-giving properties of the aeon orbs flourish within you.
feats.text: The life-giving properties of the   flourish within you. Small plants or fungi magically appear on all surfaces in a 60-foot emanation around you. This life withers after 1 day unless the environment can support it. You can choose one of the following options each time you use this feat.  You can cause any number of 5-foot squares in the area to be light undergrowth, which is difficult terrain and provides lesser cover. You can cause a tree or giant mushroom to appear in any unoccupied location in the area; it occupies an entire 5-foot square and provides standard cover. The tree or mushroom has 5 Hardness and 50 Hit Points.

feats.name: Reflecting Riposte
feats.prerequisites: Dueling Riposte, Mirror Shield, or Twin Riposte
feats.benefits: You attempt to counteract the triggering spell using powerful magical techniques observed in the Kortos Mounts.
feats.text: You attempt to  counteract  the triggering spell using powerful magical techniques observed in the Kortos Mounts. Use your attack roll modifier with your shield or parrying weapon for your counteract check. If you counteract the spell, it is reflected upon the caster. If the spell targeted individual creatures, it targets the caster only. If the spell targeted an area centered on a point, the new area is centered on the caster. If the spell was a cone or line, the cone or line emanates from you toward the caster. If the spell has a save DC, it uses your class DC, and if it requires a spell attack roll, use the same attack roll modifier as the counteract check.

feats.name: Endurance of the Rooted Tree
feats.benefits: Just as the Vale of Aroden retains light and life despite inhospitable surroundings, you can sustain yourself regardless of your environment.
feats.text: Just as the Vale of Aroden retains light and life despite inhospitable surroundings, you can sustain yourself regardless of your environment. You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe. In addition, you can cast the  wholeness of body  ki spell almost effortlessly. You can cast it as a free action that triggers at the start of your turn.

feats.name: Golden Body
feats.benefits: Strike harder and heal more rapidly.
feats.text: You perfect your body, refining the flex of every muscle and the bend of every joint to maximum efficiency. Your unarmed Strikes gain the  deadly d12  trait, and you have  fast healing 20 , causing you to regain 20 HP at the start of each of your turns provided you have at least 1 HP.   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. If the PCs secure Visitor’s Pins or an alliance with Mengkare, their access to Promise’s trainers and records unlock all of the following uncommon class feats. :  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,  ,

feats.name: Mimic Protections
feats.benefits: By adopting resonant reflections, you have learned to copy the abilities of other creatures as well.
feats.text: By adopting  , you have learned to copy the abilities of other creatures as well. When you use  Hunt Prey  on a foe within 100 feet, you gain resistance 10 to all damage types that target has resistance or immunity to for as long as the foe remains within 100 feet.

feats.name: Superior Sight
feats.benefits: Increase your visual acuity.
feats.text: Your senses are peerless. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks, and you gain  low-light vision . If you already have low-light vision, gain  darkvision  instead. Furthermore, when you target an enemy, you automatically succeed at the flat check if that enemy is concealed, hidden, or undetected. feats.name: Deadly Poison Weapon
feats.benefits: Your poisons are devastatingly potent.
feats.text: Your poisons are devastatingly potent. When you apply a simple poison with  Poison Weapon , the poison deals 4d4 poison damage instead of 1d4 poison damage. When you apply an  injury  poison to your weapon, the DC to resist that poison increases by 2, to a maximum of your class DC.

feats.name: Enduring Debilitation
feats.benefits: Your debilitations last for 1 minute.
feats.text: You can make your debilitation last an exceptionally long time. The triggering debilitation lasts for 1 minute instead of until the end of your next turn.   Pathfinder #150: Broken Promises pg. 75 The citizens of Promise represent some of the most capable experts, greatest minds, and powerful warriors on Golarion—ideal teachers and trainers for PCs who want to maximize their own potential. feats.name: Steal Essence
feats.prerequisites: legendary in Thievery or master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion
feats.benefits: Being in the presence of the aeon orbs as they deteriorated has taught you how to siphon energy, and you do so with the required magic item.
feats.text: Being in the presence of the   as they deteriorated has taught you how to siphon energy, and you do so with the required magic item. The DC to steal the properties of a magic item is equal to the DC for the item's level or the normal DC to  Steal  the item, whichever is higher. The targeted item then becomes temporarily immune for 24 hours. If the object was on a creature, that creature is also temporarily immune (which prevents you from attempting to Steal the Essence of another object on it).  If you successfully steal the properties of an item, it loses its magical properties for 24 hours and you can move those properties to a non-magical object of the same general kind (such as moving a hat's properties to another piece of headgear or moving a weapon's properties to another weapon) for the same length of time. If the moved properties are  counteracted , they return immediately to the original item. You automatically fail to Steal the Essence of an  artifact ,  cursed item , or similar item.

feats.name: Bloodline Metamorphosis
feats.benefits: Swap out spells from your repertoire more easily.
feats.text: You have learned to manipulate the innate power of your bloodline and adapt it to your needs. When making your daily preparations, you can swap out a single spell of 9th level or lower for another spell of the same level. You can’t swap out spells granted specifically by your bloodline. feats.name: Tenacious Blood Magic
feats.benefits: You have learned how to invest magic more deeply by witnessing Aroden's works.
feats.text: You have learned how to invest magic more deeply by witnessing Aroden's works. The triggering blood magic effect lasts for 1 minute instead of 1 round.

feats.name: Reclaim Spell
feats.benefits: You have learned to manipulate reflections of magic, similar to the resonant reflections.
feats.text: You have learned to manipulate reflections of magic, similar to the  . You reclaim the magic of an ongoing spell, using it reprepare a spell with a duration. You Dismiss a Spell of 4th level or lower that you cast today from a spell slot with at least half its duration remaining, even if that spell can't normally be Dismissed. You can then spend 10 minutes to reprepare the spell in that spell slot, as  Reprepare Spell .
